Package sportstournament.main

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
sportstournament.main.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment extends Object
This class implements a GameEnvironment. It keeps track of the game, such as the weeks, money, and points. It handles requests from the UI and updates the state of the game where necessary.
Author:
Isaac Steele + Reuben Schoonbee

    • GameEnvironment

      public GameEnvironment(CommandLine ui, ArrayList<Athlete> draft)
      A constructor for GameEnvironment, called from the Main class to begin the setup of the game.
      Parameters:
      ui - The instance of CommandLine being used.
      draft - A list of Athletes to be drafted.

    • finishSetup

      public void finishSetup(String name, ArrayList<Athlete> team, int numWeeks, String difficulty)
      Finishes setup and starts the main game
      Parameters:
      name - The chosen name for the team
      team - The list of Athletes drafted.
      numWeeks - The chosen number of weeks for the game
      difficulty - The selected difficulty

    • takeBye

      public String takeBye()
      Moves the game to the next week. Updates the Market and Stadium and has a chance a random event occurs.
      Returns:
      A string that contains the random event that occurred or "None" if none occur.
